meanings.definition: Soft and wet, making a splashing sound when pressed
meanings.sent1: The sponge was squishy when I squeezed it.
meanings.sent2: The ripe tomato felt squishy in my hand.
meanings.sent3: The squishy mud made funny noises as I walked through it.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt squishy with emotion as she watched the touching movie.
meanings.sent5: The jellyfish was so squishy that it slipped out of my hand easily.

meanings.sent1: The stress ball was squishy and changed shape when squeezed.
meanings.sent2: The marshmallow was so squishy that it flattened easily.
meanings.sent3: The squishy balloon popped as soon as I touched it.
meanings.sent4: His ego was as squishy as a marshmallow, easily deflated by criticism.
meanings.sent5: The snow was so squishy that it melted in my hand.

meanings.sent1: The wet socks felt squishy against my skin.
meanings.sent2: The overripe banana was squishy and unpleasant to touch.
meanings.sent3: The squishy bread left a soggy mess on the plate.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were as squishy as a wet sponge, lacking substance.
meanings.sent5: The mud was so squishy that it oozed between my toes.
